title: Friedrich Air Conditioning old logotype
content:
Is the slab serif font of the old logotype for [Friedrich Air Conditioning Co.](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203170555/http:/www.friedrich.com/) custom made? It reminds me a bit of Beton, Stymie and in part Peter Bruhns Farao. The closest I’ve found so far is [Clarity](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203170555/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/astigmatic/clarity-aoe/) by Astigmatic but that’s no match.

Anyone got a clue?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203170555im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Friedrich_4833.jpg)

 [‹ Trying to identify this font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203170555/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38385 "Go to previous forum topic") [I have found a font similar to the Gucci logo ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203170555/http:/www.typophile.com/node/28847 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Marten Fischer

comments.content:
Here’s another sample. This one got a different kerning to it...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203170555im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Friedrich_kern_6145.jpg)

...and now I see that the dots over the i’s are different too. This I think further speaks for a custom work?

Any suggestions?
